column1: The Study's most crucial justification is its aim to provide expert-informed guidance ensuring AI's broad societal and individual benefits.
column2: What is the most defensible purpose of the One Hundred Year Study's periodic expert review?
column3: Justify why the Study Panel only convenes every five years.
column4: Critique the decision to model the study on the Asilomar meeting.
column5: Judge the effectiveness of the 2008 AAAI Asilomar Study.
column6: What is the most defensible purpose of the One Hundred Year Study's periodic expert review?

column1: Inadequate data for model training is the primary obstacle to defining AI (Section I, defining AI).
column2: Defend the idea that an accurate and sophisticated picture of AI is hampered by the difficulty of a precise definition.
column3: Assess the challenge of pinning down a precise definition of Artificial Intelligence.
column4: Evaluate the unevenness of progress within and among the eight domains of study.
column5: Critique the notion that current AI systems are specialized rather than "general purpose."
column6: Assess the challenge of pinning down a precise definition of Artificial Intelligence.

column1: The technical focus on deep learning is the single greatest trend driving current AI research.
column2: Critique the importance of Natural Language Processing or Reinforcement Learning as current research trends.
column3: Justify why AI research is shifting towards building intelligent systems that can collaborate effectively with people.
column4: Judge which Al Research Trend has been most propelled forward by impressive empirical successes.
column5: Evaluate the relative importance of computing resources (cloud) versus data availability in accelerating AI research.
column6: Judge which Al Research Trend has been most propelled forward by impressive empirical successes.

column1: Search and Planning are the most historically important sub-areas of AI.
column2: Compare the current relevance of the traditional sub-areas of AI like Search to those that are "hotter" today.
column3: Justify the claim that machine learning has been the key contributor to the AI surge in the past few decades.
column4: Evaluate the necessity of Multi-Agent Systems in on-line marketplaces and transportation.
column5: Critique the role of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning in the success of programs like IBM's Watson.
column6: Compare the current relevance of the traditional sub-areas of AI like Search to those that are "hotter" today.

column1: The success of the AlphaGo program is the best illustration of the need for integration across AI sub-fields.
column2: Critique the importance of Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing in the development of robotics.
column3: Assess the role of synthesizing intelligence across multiple sub-fields for complex real-world applications.
column4: Evaluate the long-term impact of Social Network Analysis on understanding community behavior.
column5: Judge the effectiveness of crowdsourcing as an innovative problem-solving technique relying on human intelligence.
column6: Assess the role of synthesizing intelligence across multiple sub-fields for complex real-world applications.

column1: The need for continuous monitoring from personal devices is the key advancement in Healthcare.
column2: Defend the proposition that AI-based applications could improve health outcomes and quality of life for millions of people.
column3: Judge the role of electronic health records and mobile apps in collecting useful data.
column4: Critique the statement that advances in fluid human-machine interaction are crucial for healthcare.
column5: Evaluate the potential of removing policy and regulatory obstacles to accelerate AI innovation in Healthcare.
column6: Defend the proposition that AI-based applications could improve health outcomes and quality of life for millions of people.

column1: AI's greatest educational value lies in its potential to provide personalization at scale.
column2: Critique the claim that quality education will always require active engagement by human teachers.
column3: Justify the assertion that AI enhances education primarily by offering personalization at scale.
column4: Assess whether the use of AI in classrooms will expand significantly over the next fifteen years.
column5: Judge the significance of interactive machine tutors in teaching science and math.
column6: Justify the assertion that AI enhances education primarily by offering personalization at scale.

column1: The underinvestment in AI research lacking commercial application is the primary reason Low-resource Communities have not benefited more from AI.
column2: Assess whether budding efforts using data mining to address social problems are promising.
column3: Critique the challenge of gaining public trust in low-resource communities for AI deployment.
column4: Defend the importance of targeted funding to apply AI methods to assist Low-resource Communities.
column5: Judge the role of targeted incentives and funding priorities in addressing low-resource community needs.
column6: Defend the importance of targeted funding to apply AI methods to assist Low-resource Communities.

column1: The threat of systematizing human bias is the single greatest risk in deploying AI for Public Safety and Security.
column2: Evaluate whether predictive policing raises the specter of unjustifiably monitoring innocent people.
column3: Assess the most serious ethical concern surrounding the deployment of predictive policing and surveillance technologies.
column4: Judge the potential for AI prediction tools to reduce human bias rather than reinforcing it.
column5: Critique the care taken to protect civil liberties when relying heavily on AI by 2030.
column6: Assess the most serious ethical concern surrounding the deployment of predictive policing and surveillance technologies.

column1: AI will likely replace tasks rather than jobs in the near term, making the need for social debate non-urgent.
column2: Compare the near-term economic impact of AI replacing jobs versus the longer-term vision of wealth creation.
column3: Defend the argument that AI will likely replace tasks rather than jobs in the near term.
column4: Judge whether it is too soon for a social debate on sharing the economic fruits of AI technologies.
column5: Predict the type of new jobs that will emerge to offset the jobs lost to AI.
column6: Compare the near-term economic impact of AI replacing jobs versus the longer-term vision of wealth creation.
